description: This chapter contains Paul's advice regarding marriage, divorce, and widowhood. Paul addresses questions about marriage relationships, singleness, and how believers should live in various life situations during a time of present distress.

questions.question: What is good for a man according to verse 1?
options: To have sexual relations with a woman
Not to have sexual relations with a woman

questions.question: But since sexual immorality is occurring, what should each man and woman do?
options: Each man should have sexual relations with his own wife, and each woman with her own husband

questions.question: What should the husband fulfill to his wife?
Who has authority over the wife's body?
Who has authority over the husband's body?
When may spouses deprive each other?
options: Perhaps by mutual consent and for a time, so that you may devote yourselves to prayer

questions.question: Why should couples come together again after a time of abstinence?
options: So that Satan will not tempt you because of your lack of self-control

questions.question: How does Paul describe his statement about temporary separation?
How does Paul wish all people would be?
What does Paul acknowledge about spiritual gifts?
options: Each has their own gift from God; one has this gift, another has that

questions.question: What does Paul say is good for the unmarried and widows?
options: To stay unmarried, as he does

questions.question: What should those who cannot control themselves do?
According to Paul, what is better than burning with passion?

If a wife does separate from her husband, what are her options?
options: She must remain unmarried or else be reconciled to her husband
She must move to another city

questions.question: What should a brother do if his wife is not a believer but is willing to live with him?
How is the unbelieving husband sanctified?
What should happen if the unbeliever leaves?
options: The believer must convince them to stay

questions.question: To what has God called us?
What question does Paul ask about the possibility of a spouse's salvation?
options: How do you know whether you will save your spouse?

questions.question: How should each person live according to Paul?
options: As a believer in whatever situation the Lord has assigned to them

questions.question: What counts according to Paul, not circumcision or uncircumcision?
In what should each person remain?
options: In the situation they were in when God called them

questions.question: What should those who were slaves when called not do?

How were believers purchased?
Regarding virgins, from whom does Paul have no command?
Because of the present crisis, what does Paul think is good?
options: For a man to remain as he is

questions.question: What should a man pledged to a woman not seek?
If you do marry, what have you not done?
What will those who marry face in this life?
What does Paul say about time?
What is happening to this world in its present form?
How does Paul want believers to be?
About what is an unmarried man concerned?
About what is a married man concerned?
What is an unmarried woman concerned about?

options: For their own good, not to restrict them
